definition: United Kingdom/British/England/English/abbr. for 英國|英国[Ying1 guo2]

sentences.english: One bait was down forty fathoms.
sentences.chinese: 有个鱼饵下沉到四十英寻的深处。

sentences.english: He will drop it from the ship to the ocean bottom.
sentences.chinese: 海洋底部最后的六英寻。

sentences.english: The ship sank in four fathoms.
Sailors measure the depth of the water in fathoms.
sentences.chinese: 水手们往往用英寻来测量水的深度。

sentences.english: Sailors measure the depth of the water in fathoms .
sentences.chinese: 水手用英寻来测量水深。

sentences.english: I would like to fly very slowly at two hundred fathoms high and see the fish fro above.
sentences.chinese: 我希望在两百英寻的高度飞得极慢极慢，从空中看鱼。

sentences.english: The ship sank in twenty fathoms.

definition: a Chinese foot/one-third of a meter/a ruler/a tape-measure/one of the three acupoints for measuring pulse in Chinese medicine/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3]
one of the characters used to represent a musical note in gongche notation, 工尺譜|工尺谱[gong1 che3 pu3]
a (10 meter) square/a square of given side
